name: Platform
desc: What kinds of devices will your users be using?

choices.name: Web
choices.desc: Your users will access your app from a laptop, phone, or tablet using a web browser like Chrome or Safari. This is usually cheapest, and guarantees anyone with a smartphone or computer can use your app.

choices.name: Mobile Android
choices.desc: Your users can download your app from Google Play, the Android App Store, to their Android phones or tablets.

choices.name: Mobile iOS
choices.desc: Your users can download your app from the Apple App Store to their iPhones or iPads.

name: Authentication
desc: How will your users sign in? (If you or your users aren't saving information anywhere, you might not need this at all!)

choices.name: Sign in through a social network
choices.desc: Google, Twitter, Facebook, LinkedIn, Github... These all provide ways of letting people log in and sign up. How many social networks do you want to include?

choices.name: Sign in without going through anyone else's site
choices.desc: This is more expensive than letting people use their social media accounts, but means you have more control over your user experience.

choices.name: Admin portal
choices.desc: Use a secure admin account to manage your users and your data.

name: Database
desc: Where does your app get its data? Where does it send new data?

choices.name: Read from a spreadsheet or table
choices.desc: Your app pulls data from a CSV or JSON file that you own. This is great when your data is rarely going to change, like if you want to show data from a census or survey.

choices.name: Read from someone's API
choices.desc: Your app tells you whether it's raining using data from the National Weather Service, or shows graphs of basketball scores from ESPN, or visualizes data that it gets from someone else's site.

choices.name: Write to someone's API
choices.desc: You forward user input to Salesforce, Mailchimp, or some other provider.

choices.name: Read from and write to a SQL database
choices.desc: You will be sifting through a lot of data, maybe more than 10,000 records. You might be managing complex relationships, like with a social network. This will be handled with PHP and MySQL.

choices.name: Read from and write to a real-time database
choices.desc: It's important that your users see data change in real-time: if a person on Computer B types something in, a person on Computer A sees it immediately. This will be handled by Google Firebase.

name: Design
desc: How much work, if any, needs to be put into your user interface?

choices.name: Basic responsive styling
choices.desc: Bootstrap or another CSS framework with some very light customization will make sure your app looks clean and presentable on most web browsers.

choices.name: Pixel-perfect wireframes
choices.desc: Professional wireframes are much more than a sketch or mock-up. Having a development-minded designer establish your layout will keep you from spending too much on programmers: you'll know exactly what you want, and they'll know exactly what to code. You won't need to make lots of small costly tweaks as you go.

choices.name: A unique, branded look-and-feel
choices.desc: User experience is the most important thing to your app's success, and the hardest thing to get right. Design professionals will work with you to define the typesets, colors, buttons, icons, and logos that add the most to your bottom line. Packaged up with all the necessary font files, images, and hex codes, this style guide can be incorporated into any other project.

choices.name: Custom graphics
choices.desc: Even the smallest logo or icon can take a lot of time and thought. How many custom graphics do you need?

name: Features
desc: What else will you add to your app to make it unique?

choices.name: File upload
choices.desc: Let your users upload pictures, videos, and documents.

choices.name: Data reporting
choices.desc: Aggregate and display data in a slick graphical or print-friendly format.

choices.name: Automatic e-mails
choices.desc: The app will use a template to automatically send e-mails.

choices.name: Analytics
choices.desc: Incorporate Google analytics or similar into your app.

choices.name: Payment processing
choices.desc: Use Stripe, PayPal, Bitcoin, or a similar third-party service to collect payments.
